currentItem.name: HTML
currentItem.subTitle: Markup language for web UI
currentItem.description:
HTML is made out of tags. 
Tags can hold values with attributes.
 For example: 
<html attribute="attribute value">

parts.title: HTML tag structure
parts.description:
An html tag is made out of it's openning tag, closing tag, it's content in the middle and it's attributes and values on it's opening tag. There are tags the don't have closing tags like the
and tags.

parts.title: HTML page structure
parts.description:
An html page is the base of the website.
It defines the HTML version, meta data and the elements of the page.
From displaying inputs to loading files, you can do a lot with a few steps in HTML
parts.bottomText: You can create your own html files like this "index.html" or "any-name_you_want.html" and open it in your browser just by double clicking on it.

parts.description: An achor tag can redirect the user to any page online or other files on you machine.

parts.description: An image tag can show an image online or from on you computer.

parts.title: The input tag gets different types of input from the user. <input type="text" />
parts.description: With the input tag and the select and option tags you can ask the user many different types of questions to get his input.

parts.title: Connecting HTML and CSS
parts.description:
To insert CSS code in an HTML page we use the or on the tag with "style" attribute

text
parts.bottomText: You can create your own css files like this "index.css" or "any-name_you_want.css", connect it to an html page and open it in your browser.

parts.title: Selectors
parts.description: In order to set design rules with CSS to an HTML element (tag).  We need to use a selector, to specify which element should the rules (declarations) apply to.

parts.title: Pseudo selectors (special selectors)
parts.description: There are some special rules selectors to be more specific about which tags should be changed. depending on the tag state or place in the page.

parts.title: CSS rules (declarations)
parts.description: CSS rules are style declarations of how the selected element should appear. There are many but we will focus here on the basic ones.

parts.title: CSS rules positioning: display and position
parts.description: Many time you will find yourself in need of change the behaviour of elements with others in the page. For those cases knowing the display and position are really useful.

parts.title: CSS rules spacing: margin and padding
parts.description: To control the spacing between elements on the page we use margin and padding rules. They are similar besided the fact that margin effects the outer part of the element and padding effects the inner part of the element.

parts.title: CSS rules fonts: font-family, font-size and more...
parts.description: Font rules enable you to change how text appears and much more. Some of the basic useful font rules are: font-family, font-size, color, line-height, font-weight and font-style

parts.title: Media queries (mobile and different screen sizes)
parts.description: Media queries are blocks of css with a condition to apply when it fits. Mostly used to activate rules per the screen width for mobile, tablet and desktop devices.
